description: Journalist â€“ turned - User Experience Researcher
with interests in information architecture, content strategy and UX Design.
description2: Due to my naturally curious personality, I strive to understand people and their behaviors in order to find solutions to complex problems. I want to engage in purpose-driven work that results in a positive impact for the targeted audience.

description: Currently, I am a second-year graduate student at the University of Michigan School of Information studying human-computer interaction. I am seeking full time user experience research positions in the Detroit metropolitan area starting in August 2016.
I'm naturally curious about human behavior. My talents as a user experience practioner are my abilities to assess problems and analyze data.
An East Coast girl in a Midwest world, I am originally from Long Island, NY. I received my bachelor's degree in English from Howard University in Washington, D.C..
While in school, I started my professional career in journalism after securing my first editorial internship with Black Enterprise magazine in New York City.

Since then, I gained skills in print and online journalism, social media, web production, and public relations. My work has been featured in Black Enterprise Magazine, Essence Magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Howard University's Alumni Magazine, TheAtlantaPost.com, MadameNoire.com, Diverse: Issues in Higher Education and Shelterforce Magazine.
description2: Outside of my professional interest in user experience, I also have an interest in entrepreneurship. I am enjoying the activity and the spirit of Detroit, especially as a foodie surrounded by so much great food!
I love animals and my happy places are home in LI, Eastern Market, Barnes & Noble, the gym and the kitchen.
Want to know more? Feel free to reach me via Email, Twitter or LinkedIn.

video.title: video
video.imagemsg: In the fall of 2015, I was a speaker at Ignite UX Michigan, where I gave a 5 minute lightning talk about the importance of equitable design. This was my first public appearance and I am grateful for the opportunity to share my perspective with the UX community.
